custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the ballpark guide
and has not already added the program for that ballpark
and taps on the 'Club Members' button in the grid
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the onboarding process for programs

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an account we are logged into is part of a program
and the account has an amount of eCash added to it
and we look on the program view
and we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see the balance displayed correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an account we are logged into is part of a program
and the account has 0 eCash
and we look on the program view
and we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see the 0 balance displayed correctly ($0.00)

Account: wasfortress2@mlb.com baseball

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an account we are logged into is part of a program
and the account has an amount of loyalty added to it
and we look on the program view
and we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see the balance displayed correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When an account we are logged into is part of a program
and the account has 0 loyalty (Account: wasfortress1@mlb.com)
and we look on the program view
and we look on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see the 0 balance displayed correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to their program page
and content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see there personal information at the top
and the Event Information for the next event available or current active event will be below that
and below that there will be a link saying 'View home team Park Guide' 
and there will be a section with the user's cards available for entry today
and there will be a section for other cards in your account that are not applicable to today's event
and there will be a Services section with different options (Options under services vary with different clubs)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the UniPass program page
and taps on an available card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a modal will open
and the modal will contain Event Information
and the barcode for the seat
and the user's membership information
and there will be an 'X' to close the modal in the top left corner
and the user will see a page indicator at the bottom if multiple cards are present

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on their UniPass Program View
and has multiple cards
and has tapped on a card (seat)
and the UniPass Scan modal has opened
and the user swipes to the left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the modal will switch between cards
and the page indicator at the bottom will update accordingly

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the program view
or the user is on the scan view
and the user looks at the event information
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the time will be localized to match the timezone of the event stadium's timezone

(i.e. Washington=EST, BOS=EST, SD=PST)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Program View
and taps on a "card"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the scan view modal will open
and the device's brightness will automatically be boosted to full

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has passes in their Program View that are listed in the 'Other passes in your account' section
and taps on one of these passes
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Scan View
and the user will see an icon with a ticket and circle around the ticket with a diagonal line going through it. Next to that icon you will a message stating 'Not valid for entry'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the Program View
or the user is on the Scan View
and looks at the seating info
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the data will be displayed correctly
and the data will match in both views

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a Multi/UniPass Program View
and taps on the Manage Seats button in the Services section

*Note: Manage Seats is available for WAS and SD
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Manage Seats webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a Multi/UniPass Program View
and taps on the Manage eCash button in the Services section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the eCash webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a Multi/UniPass Program View
and taps on the Rewards button in the Services section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Rewards webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a Multi/UniPass Program View
and taps on the Help button in the Services section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Help Webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on a Multi/UniPass Program View
and taps on the Privacy Policy button in the Services section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the Privacy Policy webview

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on their Program View
and has > 20 passes linked to their account
and scrolls down on the Program View
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see messaging after the first 20 passes are displayed
and the messaging will read:

'First twenty passes displayed; only twenty passes supported per account.'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to their program page
and clicks on the 'View hometeam Park Guide link located below the Event section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the ballpark guide of the hometeam stadium will come in from top to bottom

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to their program page
and scrolls down to the Services section and taps on one of the services

*Do this for each service button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
A modal for that service will open from down to up to the correct web view with the title of that service on top of the page 
and clicking 'Done' will take you back to the program page.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is on the program view
or the user is on the scan view
and looks at the event information
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the time will be localized to match the timezone of the STADIUM

(check for all US timezones)
